page.title: 12CHILDRENS'GAMES 1985
page.content: {"HOPSCOTCH" A hopping game. This game is played with 2 or more players, on a marked pitch of numbered squares.The first square is numbered 1 the next two squares adjoin each other and are numbered 2 and 3. The next square is numbered 4, and the next two 5 and 6, the next is 7, the next two 8 and 9 etc, up to 12. A stone is cast onto the pitch into one of the squares The player then hops in squares 1,4,7, and 10, and jumps alternatively in the double squares, to the square with the stone, picks it up and returns to base The game progresses from square 1 to 12. {"LEAPFROG" A vaulting game. This can be played with 3 or more players. If played with 3,1/2 bend over presenting a firm back to 3, who vaults over each, and bends over in turn, and 1 then vaults in turn etc.
